forceNewDirectivesAndFilters.name: forceNewDirectivesAndFilters
forceNewDirectivesAndFilters.comment: Creates a child injector that allows loading new directives, filters and services from the provided modules.

class.name: TemplateCache
class.preview: Infinite cache service for templates loaded from URLs.

class.name: DirectiveSelectorFactory
class.preview: Factory for creating a angular-core-dom.DirectiveSelector.

class.name: Http
class.preview: The angular-core-dom.Http service facilitates communication with the remote HTTP servers. It uses dart:html's HttpRequest and provides a number of features on top of the core Dart library.

class.name: HttpDefaults
class.preview: Injected into the angular-core-dom.Http service. This class contains application-wide HTTP defaults.

class.name: HttpDefaultHeaders
class.preview: Default header configuration.

class.name: HttpResponse
class.preview: The response for an HTTP request. Returned from the angular-core-dom.Http service.

class.name: HttpResponseConfig
class.preview: The request configuration of the request associated with this response.

class.name: HttpInterceptors
class.preview: A list of angular-core-dom.HttpInterceptors.

class.name: DefaultTransformDataHttpInterceptor
class.preview: The default transform data interceptor.abstract

class.name: HttpInterceptor
class.preview: HttpInterceptors are used to modify the Http request. They can be added to angular-core-dom.HttpInterceptors or passed into angular-core-dom.Http.call.

class.name: HttpBackend
class.preview: HTTP backend used by the angular-core-dom.Http service that delegates to dart:html's HttpRequest and deals with Dart bugs.

class.name: ElementBinder
class.preview: ElementBinder is created by the Selector and is responsible for instantiating individual directives and binding element properties.

class.name: TemplateLoader
class.preview: TemplateLoader is an asynchronous access to ShadowRoot which is loaded asynchronously. It allows a Component to be notified when its ShadowRoot is ready.

class.name: NodeAttrs
class.preview: NodeAttrs is a facade for element attributes. The facade is responsible for normalizing attribute names as well as allowing access to the value of the directive.

class.name: Cookies
class.preview: Cookies service

class.name: BrowserCookies
class.preview: This class provides low-level acces to the browser's cookies. It is not meant to be used directly by applications. Instead use the Cookies service.

class.name: ElementProbe
class.preview: angular-core-dom.ElementProbe is attached to each Element in the DOM. Its sole purpose is to allow access to the di.Injector, angular-core.Scope, and Directives for debugging and automated test purposes. The information here is not used by Angular in any way.

class.name: ViewCache
class.preview: ViewCache is used to cache the compilation of templates into angular-core-dom.Views. It can be used synchronously if HTML is known or asynchronously if the template HTML needs to be looked up from the URL.

class.name: ViewFactory
class.preview: ViewFactory is used to create new angular-core-dom.Views. ViewFactory is created by the angular-core-dom.Compiler as a result of compiling a template.

class.name: BoundViewFactory
class.preview: BoundViewFactory is a angular-core-dom.ViewFactory which does not need Injector because it is pre-bound to an injector from the parent. This means that this BoundViewFactory can only be used from within a specific Directive such as NgRepeat, but it can not be stored in a cache.

class.name: ViewPort
class.preview: A ViewPort is an instance of a hole. ViewPorts designate where child angular-core-dom.Views can be added in parent angular-core-dom.View. ViewPorts wrap a DOM element, and act as references which allows more views to be added.

class.name: View
class.preview: A View is a fundamental building view of DOM. It is a chunk of DOM which can not be structural changed. It can only have its attributes changed. A View can have angular-core-dom.ViewPorts embedded in its DOM. A angular-core-dom.ViewPort can contain other angular-core-dom.Views and it is the only way in which DOM can be changed structurally.

class.name: ElementWrapper
class.preview: ElementWrapper is an interface for angular-core-dom.Views and angular-core-dom.ViewPorts. Its purpose is to allow treating angular-core-dom.View and angular-core-dom.ViewPort under same interface so that angular-core-dom.Views can be added after angular-core-dom.ViewPort.

class.name: AnimationResult
class.preview: Final result of an animation after it is no longer attached to the element.

class.name: NoOpAnimation
class.preview: Completed animation handle that is used when an animation is ignored and the final effect of the animation is immediatly completed.

class.name: Animation
class.preview: Animation handle for controlling and listening to animation completion.

class.name: NgAnimate
class.preview: The angular-core-dom.NgAnimate service provides dom lifecycle mangement, detection and analysis of css animations, and hooks for custom animations. When any of these animations are run, angular-core-dom.Animations are returned so the animation can be controled and so that custom dom manipulations can occur when animations complete.

class.name: NgShadowRootAware
class.preview: Implementing components angular-core-dom.NgShadowRootAware.onShadowRoot method will be called when the template for the component has been loaded and inserted into Shadow DOM. It is guaranteed that when angular-core-dom.NgShadowRootAware.onShadowRoot is invoked, that shadow DOM has been loaded and is ready.

DirectiveSelector.name: DirectiveSelector
DirectiveSelector.comment:
DirectiveSelector is a function which given a node it will return a list of [DirectiveRef]s which are triggered by this node.

DirectiveSelector is used by the [Compiler] during the template walking to extract the [DirectiveRef]s.

DirectiveSelector can be created using the [directiveSelectorFactory] method.

The DirectiveSelector supports CSS selectors which do not cross element boundaries only. The selectors can have any mix of element-name, class-names and attribute-names.

Examples:

  element
  .class
  [attribute]
  [attribute=value]
  element[attribute1][attribute2=value]

AttributeChanged.name: AttributeChanged
AttributeChanged.comment: Callback function used to notify of attribute changes.
